snippet: In her annual report to Congress, Nina E. Olson suggested repealing the alternative minimum tax and reducing so-called tax expenditures — income exclusions, deductions and credits.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service ombudsman Nina E Olson, in annual report to Congress, says lawmakers need to overhaul tax code completely to reduce burden on taxpayers just to file return; suggests repealing alternative minimum tax and reducing so-called tax expenditures.
lead_paragraph: In her annual report to Congress, Nina E. Olson suggested repealing the alternative minimum tax and reducing so-called tax expenditures — income exclusions, deductions and credits.

headline.seo: I.R.S.’s Taxpayer Advocate Calls for a Tax Code Overhaul
